Package sorcer.provider.boot

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ActivateWrapper
    A wrapper for activatable objects, providing separation of the import codebase (where the server classes are loaded from by the activation group) from the export codebase (where clients should load classes from for stubs, etc.) as well as providing an independent security policy file for each activatable object.
    ActivateWrapper.ActivateDesc
    Descriptor for registering a "wrapped" activatable object.
    Booter
    Provides static convenience methods for use in configuration files.
    ClassAnnotator
    Provides support to annotate classes required for dynamic class loading in RMI
    CommonClassLoader
    The CommonClassLoader implements sorcer.provider.core.jsb.ComponentLoader interface and is created by the sorcer.provider.boot.RioServiceDescriptor or sorcer.provider.boot.RioActivatableServiceDescriptor when starting a Rio service and contains common declared platform JARs to be made available to its children.
    InstrumentationHook
    Allows the instrumentation class to be accessed
    PlatformLoader
    Parses platform configuration documents
    PlatformLoader.Capability
    Contains attributes for a platform capability.
    RegistryUtil
    Utility for getting/creating the RMI Registry.
    ServiceClassLoader
    The ServiceClassLoader overrides getURLs(), ensuring all classes that need to be annotated with specific location(s) are returned appropriately
    SorcerDescriptorUtil
    Holds static attributes used during the startup of services and provides utilities to obtain ServiceDescriptor instances for SORCER services
    SorcerServiceDescriptor
    The SorcerServiceDescriptor class is a utility that conforms to the Jini™ technology ServiceStarter framework, and will start a service using the CommonClassLoader as a shared, non-activatable, in-process service.
    SorcerServiceDescriptor.Created
    Object returned by SorcerServiceDescriptor.create() method that returns the proxy and implementation references for the created service.
